title: Finance / Account Manager Job at Laboria Limited
content:
Laboria Limited, a Hospital and Laboratory Equipment Solutions Provider, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance / Account Manager

Job Location: Ojodu-Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Finance/Account Manager with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing financial operations, managing receivables, preparing daily sales reports, and generating monthly management reports.


Key Responsibilities
Accounts Receivables Management:


	Monitor and manage customer accounts to ensure timely invoicing and collections.
	Review outstanding receivables and actively follow up with customers to minimize overdue payments.
	Ensure effective compliance with credit control processes / policy to reduce bad debts and improve cash flow.
	Prepare and analyze receivables aging reports and provide regular updates to management.
	Liaise with customers to resolve any billing discrepancies or disputes promptly.


Financial Management:


	Oversee and maintain accurate financial records, ensuring compliance with accounting standards.
	Manage accounts payable and ensure timely payments to vendors.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor cash flow for operational efficiency.


Reporting:


	Prepare and review Daily Sales Reports (DSRs) for accuracy and completeness.
	Generate and present Monthly Management Reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
	Provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.


Budgeting and Forecasting:


	Assist in preparing budgets, forecasts, and variance analysis.
	Monitor expenditures to ensure alignment with the budget.


Compliance and Audit:


	Ensure compliance with financial regulations, tax laws, and company policies.
	Support internal and external audits by providing necessary documentation and reports.


System and Process Management:


	Use QuickBooks to manage financial transactions and reports efficiently.
	Implement and maintain effective financial controls and processes.


Team Collaboration:


	
	Work closely with other departments to align financial objectives with organizational goals.
	


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Effective management of accounts receivables, ensuring minimal overdue payments and achieving target collection rates.
	Timely and accurate preparation of Daily Sales Reports (DSRs).
	Submission of Monthly Management Reports by agreed deadlines.
	Maintenance of 100% compliance with financial regulations and tax obligations.
	Efficient use of QuickBooks for all financial operations and reporting.


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in finance or accounting roles.
	Proficiency in QuickBooks is mandatory.
	Professional certification (e.g., ICAN, ACA, ACCA, CPA) will be an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and regulatory requirements.
	Demonstrated experience in managing accounts receivables, including credit control and debt recovery.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite, especially Excel.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us


	Opportunity to work with a dynamic and forward-thinking team.
	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Professional growth and development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: laboriahr@gmail.com using “Application for Finance/Account Manager.” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at SOW Real Estate Limited
content:
Sow Real Estate Nig. Ltd. is a real estate company that is focused ondelivering quality and affordable housing in Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head of Engineering

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As we scale our operations, we are seeking a seasoned and strategic Head of Engineering to lead our engineering and project execution functions.
	The Head of Engineering will oversee the entire engineering and technical operations of the company.
	This role involves leading a multidisciplinary team of engineers, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
	The ideal candidate must have extensive experience in construction engineering, project management, and real estate development.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage the engineering department, including civil, structural, electrical, and mechanical engineers.
	Oversee the planning, design, and execution of all engineering projects.
	Develop and enforce engineering policies, standards, and procedures.
	Evaluate and implement new technologies and innovations in construction methods.
	Manage budgets, project schedules, and resource allocation.
	Conduct site inspections to ensure compliance with designs, safety, and quality standards.
	Collaborate with architects, contractors, and consultants to ensure seamless project execution.
	Provide technical guidance and mentorship to engineering teams.
	Ensure all engineering activities comply with local and international building codes, health and safety regulations.
	Prepare technical reports, risk assessments, and performance metrics for executive leadership.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Building Technology, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
	Minimum of 5 - 8 years of engineering experience, with at least 3 years in a senior or leadership role within the real estate or construction sector.
	COREN certification is an advantage; other professional certifications (e.g., PMP, MNSE) are also added advantage.
	Proven experience in leading large-scale residential and commercial real estate projects.
	Strong knowledge of construction standards, materials, methodologies, and project lifecycle management.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in engineering and project management software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit, MS Project, Primavera).
	Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive engineering excellence.
	Deep understanding of Nigerian regulatory standards and approval processes for real estate developments.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
	Health and wellness benefits
	A dynamic and collaborative work environment
	Opportunity to work on innovative and landmark real estate projects
	Career development and continuous learning opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: osezzbank@gmail.com using  “Head of Engineering - SOW Real Estates” as the subject.

 

 

2.) Investment Advisor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Description


	We are seeking passionate and driven Investment Advisors (Marketers) to join our dynamic team in Abuja. Ideal candidates should have 1 - 3 years of experience in sales, preferably within the real estate sector (though this is not compulsory).
	If you have a strong network of buyers and are looking to grow in a supportive and professional environment, we want to hear from you!


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and engage prospective investors and buyers
	Promote investment opportunities and guide clients through decision-making
	Build and maintain long-term client relationships
	Meet and exceed sales targets
	Attend team coaching and mentorship sessions.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of sales experience (real estate experience is an added advantage)
	Proven network or contacts of potential buyers
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Self-motivated, proactive, and eager to learn
	Must be based in Abuja or willing to relocate.


What We Offer


	Competitive Monthly Salary, attractive commissions and performance-based incentives
	A supportive, high-performance work environment
	Mentorship and hands-on coaching to boost your career
	Opportunities for professional growth and leadership development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: osezzbank@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Sales Manager

Job Location:  Abuja (FCT) 

Job Description


	We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Sales Manager to lead a dynamic real estate sales team in Abuja.
	The ideal candidate must have a proven track record in property sales, with a strong network of high-net-worth clients and decision-makers capable of investing in premium real estate within the Abuja market.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead, motivate, and manage a team of sales executives to achieve and exceed sales targets.
	Develop and execute strategic plans to drive property sales, with a particular focus on high-end residential and commercial developments.
	Leverage an existing network of qualified clients to generate leads and close high-value deals.
	Provide market insights and customer feedback to guide marketing and business development strategies.
	Coordinate property viewings, client meetings, and contract negotiations.
	Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction throughout the sales process.


Key Requirements


	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in real estate sales, preferably in Abuja.
	Demonstrated success in selling luxury or high-value properties.
	Extensive client base and strong network of prospective property buyers and investors in Abuja.
	Proven ability to lead and develop a high-performing sales team.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.
	Strong understanding of the Abuja real estate market, pricing trends, and buyer behavior.


Incentives


	Competitive salary and performance-based commissions.
	Availability of team vehicle
	Fuel Allowance
	Opportunities for career growth and continuous professional development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to: osezzbank@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Contracts Engineer / Buyer Job at Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited
content:
Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited (formerly Moody International Nigeria Limited) was established in 1996 as a partnership between Moody International Group and Nigerian investors. Since commencing operations in March 1997 the company continues to grow and exerts its presence in numerous Projects in the Nigeria Oil and Gas Industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contracts Engineer / Buyer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Contract

Responsibilities 
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The post holder is responsible for pre-award preparation, negotiation, award and monitoring the administration of Contracts for works/goods/services in such a manner as to ensure the Company’s best commercial interests are both served and protected, while monitoring relevant markets and supporting contractor performance management.
	Organize and control all process-based activities relating to offshore service contracts in assigned portfolio including strategies, pre-qualifications, tender list development, issues of ITT, analysis of tenders, contract negotiations and the preparation of contractual documentation.
	Proactively work with the métier partners (Technical Duets) to build and maintain relationships with contractors / suppliers and monitor their performance by participating in contract performance management activities.
	Liaise closely with the relevant Global Category Manager to locally deploy TGP strategy and comply with TGP governance.
	Actively pursue contracting synergy opportunities for all business requirements.
	Actively contribute to the 3C program by delivery of costs savings without compromising safety or quality.
	Ensure that contractor / supplier selection is carried out in accordance with Company requirements and Compliance
	Program and that safety and environmental assessments are part of the selection process.
	Mitigate project risk through pro-active management and negotiation of contractual disputes.
	Provide proactive and timely advice and support to internal and external stakeholders in all matters relating to Contracts & Procurement, including operating as a ‘Duet’ with the technical counterpart to promote effective contract planning, management and performance.
	Utilize approved standard contract documentation and ensure compliance with standard contracting principles during negotiations.
	Comply with all applicable Supply Chain rules, governance, and process.
	Support settlement of claims, in conjunction with senior management and Legal, by proposing strategies and actions and by participating in negotiations.
	Contribute to the process of continuous improvement, including participation in and promotion of Lean initiatives and adoption and sharing of best practice.
	Prepare and Present (where required) Contracts Committee presentations.
	Demonstrate personal commitment to the HSEQ Policy and actively participate in Company safety awareness and initiative schemes.
	Maintain awareness of and ensure compliance with all relevant Statutory and Company HSEQ standards.
	Effectively and efficiently use all Supply Chain Tools (SAP, E-Sourcing, AGORA, Etc.) to ensure all required information is available in a timely manner and fully auditable.
	Ensure information of portfolio is systematically updated in the Master Procurement Plan while maintaining an up-to date contract portfolio status.
	Ensure 100% compliance to COMPANY rules, SOX and local rules.
	Ensures the establishment of suitable lists of potential bidders in accordance with vendor management policies and procedures to obtain good value for money.
	Ensures contracts are drafted in accordance with approved model which reflect to company’s ethic policy, procedure thereby minimizing company’s exposure to risk.
	Contributes during negotiation either for dispute resolution and claim settlement or for generation of saving.
	Mentors Contracts Engineers, Buyers, Contracts Administrators


Job Requirements


	Fluent in English Language
	3 to 5 years of experience in oil and gas industry of which 2 years should be as a contract Engineer.
	A degree in Engineering, Management or Social Sciences (preferably Supply Chain)
	Membership of relevant professional bodies in the Supply Chain and in Operational functions will be an added advantage.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suites (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Demonstrable general knowledge and understanding of commercial, legal and insurance issues affecting the company in general.
	Excellent communication skills.
	Excellent presentation skills
	Very good organizational skills
	 Reasonable knowledge of SAP tool.
